result.name: health-wellbeing-at-work--survey-of-employers-2010-quality-of-working-life
result.notes:
Telephone survey in 2010 of 2,250 employers in Great Britain (anonymised data). This survey develops the evidence base and explores the links between health and work, as well as providing baseline data so that progress on health and well-being at work can be measured and monitored over time.

https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/214525/rrep750.pdf

organization.name: department-for-work-and-pensions
organization.title: Department for Work and Pensions
organization.description:
The Department for Work and Pensions (DWP) is responsible for welfare and pension policy and is a key player in tackling child poverty. It is the biggest public service delivery department in the UK and serves over 20 million customers.

DWP is a ministerial department, supported by 13 agencies and public bodies.

https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/department-for-work-pensions

result.title: Health & Wellbeing at Work - survey of employers 2010 (Quality of Working Life)
